I still donâ€™t believe in the supernatural, and Iâ€™m extremely skeptical; especially because I was raised a Jehovahâ€™s Witness, so my dad always explained supernatural happenings to be the demons fucking with us. (Oh, and Iâ€™m not religious anymore. However I still hold some beliefs).

Despite my disbelief in the paranormal, I have experienced multiple things. This will be quite long.

We lived in a house built in the 1960â€™s, which also happened to be near a graveyard. The first ever supernatural thing I had happen to me was one I doubt Iâ€™ll forget, as I still remember it so clearly.

1â€¢As a child, I would play games with myself, as I had no friends. I remember one game in particular where â€œmy sisterâ€ died. I was looking at my bed for a moment, and I saw someone laying there. She had a sort of white nightgown on, long, curly blonde hair, and beautiful peachy but pale skin. Her eyes were closed and her hands clasped over her stomach; similar to the way bodies are laid in a coffin. Her appearance was a bit misty. I remember being freaked out by it and for some fucking reason my dumb ass climbed into my bed, WHERE THE APPARITION WAS, and hid under my covers. Iâ€™m sure I was just using my imagination too much, though.

2â€¢ After my first experience, I had a set of recurring dreams. They were normal dreams, aside from the one â€œthingâ€ in them that always stood out. Iâ€™d be doing something, anything in my dream, when Iâ€™d see it. It was a bright, yet dull, neon green, semi-transparent person. They had wide and unblinking eyes, curly hair, and a thin smile stretched out on their face. They also had a trench coat on. No matter what, it was always staring at me. Never looking away, never blinking. I had this dream about five times, all spread out over the years. The last one I ever had was when I was eleven. I think it was a nightmare I had because of the cover to one of the Marx Brothers DVDâ€™s we had. Harpo looked fucking horrifying as a cartoon.

3â€¢ One night, Iâ€™d woken up at around 2:30-3am, and I remembered feeling watched. I looked up and was met with a pale and expressionless face, in an impossible place for a human to be. It was behind my dresser; the dresser had a large mirror on it and was pressed right against the wall. Iâ€™d be shocked if someone could get behind it. I remembered feeling terrified, but I tried to appear calm, and asked if the thing wanted help. Of course, it didnâ€™t answer. All I remember after that was falling back asleep and not having a single dream. Iâ€™m sure I was imagining it, as I woke up late at night.

4â€¢ This one didnâ€™t happen in my house, but outside it and near a power plant. I used to sneak out at night in hopes Iâ€™d have the courage to kill myself, and Iâ€™d always walk the same route. As I was walking past the power plant, I heard muffled screaming; like someone had duct tape over their mouth and was crying for help. I was terrified, so I turned my music up and kept walking (Also for reference, I didnâ€™t have earphones. I never used them when I went out, as I know itâ€™s dangerous to not be alert to your surroundings.) Thereâ€™s a chance however it couldâ€™ve just been something in the power plant humming. 

5â€¢ This one still fucks with me because I donâ€™t really have an explanation for it. One of the nights Iâ€™d snuck out, I was on my way home and had to walk past the graveyard. I heard some sort of scream from somewhere within that honestly made me so scared; my first instinct was to run, but I knew if I did, something might chase me. So I kept calm and walked on. The scream sounded inhuman, but human, and only sounded once. There is a video online of a supposed creature that comes out of the woods and scares two guys who are setting off fireworks; the way the scream sounded was similar to that, but less uhh... screechy? More hollow sort of... almost like a dog screaming, I donâ€™t know. It was horrifying to hear, though. That cemetery always freaked me out; especially the large lake that was there.

6â€¢ We moved house recently, and one night I heard footsteps coming up the hallway, but nobody was there. I went out only seconds after because I had to pee, but like I said, no-one was there. Thatâ€™s the only thing thatâ€™s ever happened in the new house, aside from a loud bang and some weird shuffling noises. I usually put these sounds down to my rats moving in the cage. 

In our old house, I never felt alone. My old room always creeped me out; I used to have nightmares so often in there. One in particular Iâ€™ll never forget, but I wonâ€™t write it here as Iâ€™ve already written too much. 

Iâ€™ve always felt like I have people or spirits around me or some shit and I hate it; Iâ€™m pretty sure itâ€™s part of my anxiety/paranoia though. Anyway, if you read this, how-dee-doo-dee, congrats. Youâ€™re now probably bored out of your mind.

Iâ€™d like to doubt Iâ€™m dehydrated, but if Iâ€™m honest with myself, I donâ€™t drink as much water as I should. I also get hypoglycaemic sometimes.

As for the bladder and bowel issues, the bowel isnâ€™t as bad as the bladder. Itâ€™s fairly okay. My bladder only gets bad around my period, and I have very irregular periods; it can sometimes be a whole month late, but theyâ€™re normal when I get them. I have been to a urologist over my bladder, however itâ€™s quite expensive, and my parents canâ€™t afford it (neither can I).

The urologist said I might have interstitial cystitis. After doing physio-therapy for a while, my bladder was okay. But I had to stop as it was costing too much..

To be honest, I deal with something very similar. The intrusive thoughts like â€œmaybe Iâ€™m not actually gay, maybe Iâ€™m bi or Iâ€™m really just straight.â€ And tbh it makes me feel really low. I donâ€™t want to identify as straight, and I know Iâ€™m not sexually attracted to men, but something is always nagging. If there is one thing you should always remember, itâ€™s this:

**Attraction should never feel uncomfortable.**

So if your attraction to men makes you feel uncomfortable in ANY way, itâ€™s likely not attraction; it might just be comphet fucking with you.

Ask yourself these questions: 

A.) Would I be happy with a man if I married one?

B.) Can I see myself enjoying intimacy with a male partner? Is it uncomfortable?

C.) How do I feel at the prospect of dating a man and possibly marrying one? Does this make me happy?

Then switch the questions so instead of a man, itâ€™s a woman in the picture. How does it make you feel? 

Honey, I sincerely hope that this can help you in some way. Please try not to stress yourself out with this; itâ€™s all going to be alright in time. I wish you all the luck, happiness, and love in the world <3
